alert.note: Alert for Charles City; Dinwiddie; Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); James City; Prince George; Surry (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 16 at 9:07PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Chesterfield, southern Charles City, Prince George, central Dinwiddie, northwestern Surry and southwestern James City Counties, the City of Colonial Heights, the City of Hopewell and the City of Petersburg through 945 PM EDT... At 907 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Hopewell to 6 miles southeast of Wilsons. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Hopewell and Fort Lee around 910 PM EDT. Jordans Point around 915 PM EDT. Garysville around 920 PM EDT. Dinwiddie around 925 PM EDT. Burrowsville around 930 PM EDT. Cabin Point around 935 PM EDT. Claremont and Carson around 940 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Taylors Corner, Burgess, Birchett Estate, Addison, Reams, Brandon, Jordan Point Country Club, Petersburg National Battlefield, Barham and New Bohemia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.

area.areaDesc: Charles City; Dinwiddie; Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); James City; Prince George; Surry
